name: GitHub Code Repo
description: Github is mature and scalable source code Platform. On top of standard source control features GitHub includes features that support modern Continuous Development through features like GitHub Actions.

name: GCP
description: Google Cloud Platform is used to provide application related infrastructure components and APIs through components like Google Cloud Endpoints.

name: Azure
description: Azure is Microsoft Cloud Platform, it is used to provide Infrastructure services like Azure Virtual Desktop as well as our Data Platform.

name: Android Apps - Customer
description: The Android operating system is used on 64% of all smartphones in Europe. Delivering an application platform that functions on Android is given.

name: Composite APIS
description: Composite APIs are a design approach to batch API requests sequentially into a single API call. Rather than multiple round trips to a server, a client can make one API request with a chain of calls and receive one response.

name: Microservices
description: Microservice architecture is a design pattern for creating application or service components that do single features. They have their own API, runtime and storage. By Isolating the architecture into these small component we can leverage agile development methods and enable upgrades/enhancements to individual components without affecting the wider application.

name: Auth0
description: Auth0 is a flexible, drop-in solution to add authentication and authorization services to applications. Auth0 was selected for its ease of implementation and strong security credentials.We have struggled with rate limiting issues and disappointing bot detection, but Auth0 remains the identity platform of choice for consumers. Auth0 was purchased by Okta in 2021.

name: commercetools
description: CommerceTools is a platform used to manage products, it takes a feed from Hamltion Grant to supply recipe and ingredient information. It is also used to hold basket information for customers that are purchasing through digital platforms.

name: Contentful
description: Contentful is a headless content management platform. It was selected for its lightweight and flexible nature.

name: Azure Data Lake
description: Azure Data Lake is a scalable storage platform used to store flat file data sets originating from different sources. We chose data lake due to its scalable and supports any flat file data type.

name: Databricks
description: Databricks is tools that enables interaction with data from code. It allows for the creation of data pipelines which we currently using to managed the promotion of through the layers of the Azure Data Platform.

name: EagleEye
description: Eagle Eye provides a service that validate customer coffee subscriptions and manages customer wallets. We chose Eagle Eye for its flexibility. It is likely we will also move to use Eagle Eye to provide customer gift card validation in the future also.

name: Atreemo
description: Atreemo is CRM platform provided by The Access Group, its currently acting as our main source of Data for customer profiles. It is also used to send out marketing emails to customers. We should continue to adopt and enhance the data in the platform.

name: Deliverect
description: Deliverct is an aggregation platform used for app based order partners like Ubereats and Deliveroo. Pret adopted Delivect due to the wide range of platforms available.

name: JavaScript
description: JavaScript is a dynamic computer programming language. It is lightweight and most commonly used as a part of web pages, whose implementations allow client-side script to interact with the user and make dynamic pages. It is an interpreted programming language with object-oriented capabilities.

name: TypeScript
description: TypeScript is a programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript and adds optional static typing to the language. TypeScript is designed for the development of large applications and transcompiles to JavaScript. As TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript, existing JavaScript programs are also valid TypeScript programs.

name: Terraform
description: Terraform is a cloud agnostic mechanism for defining Infrastructure as Code (IAC). It enables the ability to create repeatable deployments at scale. Pret chose Terraform as it is compatible with all cloud vendors. There are other similar products but most of them tend to be tied to specific cloud platforms.

name: Google Maps
description: Google Maps is the dominant mapping platform used for displaying location data. Pret chose for its market position.

name: GCP Logging
description: GCP Logging is a component of the Google Platform to provide service logging within the Google Cloud, it can also be used to ingest logging from other cloud platforms. As we move to a cloud native ecosystem GCP Logging can help us resolve the question of how we aggregate all out logs in once place.

name: Azure Blob Storage
description: Azure Storage Blobs are containers for the storage of flat files. There is no restriction on the types of files being stored making them extremely flexible. They can also mimic traditional on-premise file shares making Blob storage a great technology to assist our transition to a cloud native environment.

name: Express
description: Express.js, or simply Express, is a back end web application framework for Node.js, released as free and open-source software under the MIT License. It is designed for building web applications and APIs. It has been called the de facto standard server framework for Node.js.

name: Webpack
description: Webpack is an open-source JavaScript module bundler. It is made primarily for JavaScript, but it can transform front-end assets such as HTML, CSS, and images if the corresponding loaders are included. Webpack takes modules with dependencies and generates static assets representing those modules.

name: React
description: Reactjs is the most popular front-end JavaScript library for building Web applications. React.js or Reactjs or simply React are different ways to represent React.js. Most fortune 500 companies use Reactjs In this article, we will learn what React.js (or simply React or Reactjs) is and why we should use Reactjs instead of other JavaScript frameworks like Angular.

name: Jest
description:
Jest is a JavaScript test runner, that is, a JavaScript library for creating, running, and structuring tests.

Jest ships as an NPM package, you can install it in any JavaScript project. Jest is one of the most popular test runner these days, and the default choice for React projects.

name: Cypress
description: Cypress framework is a JavaScript-based end-to-end testing framework built on top of Mocha – a feature-rich JavaScript test framework running on and in the browser, making asynchronous testing simple and convenient. It also uses a BDD/TDD assertion library and a browser to pair with any JavaScript testing framework.

name: Service Ownership
description: A service owner is accountable for the quality of their service. In this role, you will be expected to adopt a portfolio view, managing end-to-end services that include multiple products and channels.

name: Peer Review
description: Peer review is a software quality assurance activity in which one or several people check a program mainly by viewing and reading parts of its source code. While multiple parties reviewing code does mean lower productivity per developer it generally increase the quality of the code significantly as bugs and errors in logic are identified before getting to production

name: incident response
description: Incident management (IcM) is a term describing the activities of an organization to identify, analyze, and correct hazards to prevent a future recurrence. If not managed, an incident can escalate into an emergency, crisis or a disaster. Incident management is therefore the process of limiting the potential disruption caused by such an event, followed by a return to business as usual. Without effective incident management, an incident can disrupt business operations, information security, IT systems, employees, customers, or other vital business functions.

name: Pairing / mobbing
description: Mob Programming, as known as pair programing is where more then one developer for on single software component. The purpose of this is code must be clear and well documented. This techniques tends to lead to improved quality of code by having multiple eyes and critically experience work on it.

name: GitHub Actions
description: Github Action as a feature of Git Hub that enables various automatic tasks to be carried out. The main feature of this is to push code to Test and Prod environments. This is critical to enable CI/CD pipelines. We chose Github actions due to its native integration with Git Hub.

name: GCP IAM Service accounts
description: GCP Service accounts are Google Cloud tied logins used by components/code to run. They are ONLY used by these components because they are used by the electronic systems we can construct highly complex passwords. Increasing our security posture.

name: gcp secret manager
description: Used in conjunction with service accounts. Secret manager stores these credentials in a way that consumers can access them but importantly the credentials are not stored in configuration files of such components.

name: GCP cloud run
description: Cloud Run is a serverless container platform that allows code to run isolated from the physical hardware of the server. It has the ability to scale upwards and downwards automatically reducing cost of operation.

name: Azure Event Hub
description: Azure Event hubs are used to receive asynchronous data into our azure data platform. We have had issues with scaling this tool in our transaction feed so caution should be used when designing feeds. With our desire to capture all points of data we would continue to roll this technology out with new use cases.

name: Pagerduty
description: PagerDuty allows us to route platform issues to the member of staff on call. With our extended team covering multiple partners this tool is vital, currently is only used with the digital teams. We should explore opportunities to adopt this further with our Technology estate.

name: Templated GCP Alerts
description: Currently we have alerts being generated in multiple formats. This causes issues when trying to parse them and take automated action. With our move to GCP Logging we should endeavour to create a consistent format for our alerts.

name: Microsoft Teams
description: Microsoft Teams is already used heavily by Pret staff. However we still continue to use Confluence in the digital space for communications. We should move over sites to Microsoft Groups in teams when and ass we have the chance.

name: GCP - PUBSUB
description:
Pub/Sub, which stands for Publisher/Subscriber, allows services to communicate asynchronously, with latencies on the order of 100 milliseconds.

Pub/Sub is used for streaming analytics and data integration pipelines to ingest and distribute data. It is equally effective as messaging-oriented middleware for service integration or as a queue to parallelize tasks.

name: GCP Load Balancer
description: A load balancer distributes user traffic across multiple instances of your applications. By spreading the load, load balancing reduces the risk that your applications experience performance issues.

name: GCP API Gateway
description: API Gateway enables you to provide secure access to your backend services through a well-defined REST API that is consistent across all of your services, regardless of the service implementation. Clients consume your REST APIS to implement standalone apps for a mobile device or tablet, through apps running in a browser, or through any other type of app that can make a request to an HTTP endpoint.

name: Servicenow
description: ServiceNow is a cloud-based company that provides software as a service (SaaS) for technical management support. The company specializes in IT services management (ITSM), IT operations management (ITOM) and IT business management (ITBM), allowing users to manage projects, teams and customer interactions via a variety of apps and plugins.

name: Firebase
description: Google Firebase is a Google-backed application development software that enables developers to develop iOS, Android and Web apps. Firebase provides tools for tracking analytics, reporting and fixing app crashes, creating marketing and product experiment

name: Secret and Key Management
description:
Key management refers to managing cryptographic keys within a cryptosystem. It deals with generating, exchanging, storing, using and replacing keys as needed at the user level.

A key management system will also include key servers, user procedures and protocols, including cryptographic protocol design. The security of the cryptosystem is dependent upon successful key management.

name: Failing Gracefully
description: A graceful failing is a simple programming idiom wherein a program detects a serious error condition and "exits gracefully" in a controlled manner as a result. Often the program prints a descriptive error message to a terminal or log as part of the graceful exit.

name: IOS Apps - Customer
description: The IOS operating system is used on 35% of all smartphones in Europe. Delivering an application platform that functions on Android is given.

name: Bit Rise - IOS App
description: Bitrise is a Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD) Platform as a Service (PaaS) with a main focus on mobile app development (iOS, Android, React Native, Flutter, and so on). It is a collection of tools and services to help you with the development and automation of your software projects.

name: Simphony
description: Simphony is a till system provided by the Oracle Corporation. Its is an enterprise grade EPoS platform. It's allows for central management and is integrated with our Back of House systems.

name: RBAC
description:
Role-based access control (RBAC) is a method of restricting network access based on the roles of individual users within an enterprise.

RBAC ensures employees access only information they need to do their jobs and prevents them from accessing information that doesn't pertain to them.

name: Playwright
description: Created by Microsoft, Playwright is an open source browser automation framework that allows JavaScript engineers to test their web applications on Chromium, Webkit, and Firefox browsers.

name: API Versioning and deprecation
description: A deprecated API object is positioned to be retired at a future date. Though the object remains fully supported until its retirement date, we recommend that users take advantage of newer API functionality that is meant to replace deprecated APIs at their earliest convenience. Operations for deprecated objects provide information in the response headers informing clients of the object’s status as well as deprecation and retirement dates.

name: Redux Toolkit
description: Redux is a pattern and library for managing and updating application state, using events called "actions". It serves as a centralized store for state that needs to be used across your entire application, with rules ensuring that the state can only be updated in a predictable fashion.

name: Next.js
description: Next.js is an open-source development framework built on top of Node.js enabling React based web applications functionalities such as server-side rendering and generating static websites. React documentation mentions Next.js among "Recommended Toolchains" advising it to developers as a solution when "building a server-rendered website with Node.js". Traditional React apps render all their content in the client-side browser, Next.js is used to extend this functionality to include applications rendered on the server side.

name: Open API (Swagger)
description:
The OpenAPI Specification (OAS) defines a standard, language-agnostic interface to RESTful APIs which allows both humans and computers to discover and understand the capabilities of the service without access to source code, documentation, or through network traffic inspection. When properly defined, a consumer can understand and interact with the remote service with a minimal amount of implementation logic.

An OpenAPI definition can then be used by documentation generation tools to display the API, code generation tools to generate servers and clients in various programming languages, testing tools, and many other use cases.

name: Pret Common API Standards
description: Prets Technology, and more importantly digital landscape has evolved rapidly during the last year. In term this has generated considerably more points of integration across our landscape. While on the whole these are consistent we need to develop and document a standard approach that can be followed as this ecosystem is further added to.

name: Cloud Firewalls
description: Cloud Firewalls are software-based, cloud deployed network devices, built to stop or mitigate unwanted access to private networks. As a new technology, they are designed for modern business needs, and sit within online application environments.

name: SD-WAN
description: SD-WAN stands for software-defined wide area network (or networking). A WAN is a connection between local area networks (LANs) separated by a substantial distance—anything from a few miles to thousands of miles. The term software-defined implies the WAN is programmatically configured and managed. So, it can be easily adapted quickly to meet changing needs.

name: Meraki Configuration Templates
description: Currently when we deploy new Meraki Wifi devices the configuration is largely hap hazard this leads to both an inconsistent configuration and at worse poor security implementations. Moving to standard templates for Meraki allows us to layer configuration on top of best practise templates, this will greatly reduce inconsistency and reduce the time to make changes and deploy them across the business.

name: Python
description: Python is a high-level programming language designed to be easy to read and simple to implement. It is open source, which means it is free to use, even for commercial applications. Python can run on Mac, Windows, and Unix systems and has also been ported to Java and .NET virtual machines.

name: Meraki SDK
description: The Meraki SDK is used with the Meraki rest API to duplicate template or download settings. We have had rare, very rare use case and it is something we would like to explore in the future to automate deployment using python.

name: Meraki Auto-VPN
description: Meraki auto VPN is the Meraki technology which enable IPsec tunnels between a spoke and a hub in our case shops to DC concentrator without having to configure phase1 phase2 of the VPN as traditionally done with previous Cisco firewall. It is more secure and easier to deploy (Zero touch provisioning) that's why we are using it.

name: SNMP Traps
description: SNMP traps are a mechanism used for generate event driven alerts. Unlike traditional log scaping they can be configured to be conditional, both positive and negative. The SNMP mechanism is lightweight and has also become a standard feature on more the just software. Many physical devices now support then generation of alerts through SNMP.

name: Infrastructure as Code
description: Infrastructure as code (IaC) is the process of managing and provisioning computer data centers through machine-readable definition files, rather than physical hardware configuration or interactive configuration tools. The IT infrastructure managed by this process comprises both physical equipment, such as bare-metal servers, as well as virtual machines, and associated configuration resources. The definitions may be in a version control system.

name: Cloud Native Monitoring
Azure Keyvaults
description: Azure Key Vault is a cloud hosted service offering secure storage and access for certificates, connection strings and other secrets. It streamlines the key management process and provides full control of keys for accessing and encrypting your data.

name: Azure Data Factory
description: The Azure Data Factory (ADF) is a service designed to allow developers to integrate disparate data sources. It is a platform somewhat like SSIS in the cloud to manage the data you have both on-prem and in the cloud.

name: Postgres
description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system that uses and extends the SQL language combined with many features that safely store and scale the most complicated data workloads.

name: LaunchDarkly
description: LaunchDarkly is feature management platform, it enables you to deliver features to production but only activate them for a subset of the user base. This could enable more effective functional customer testing. It can also allow develop features to be switch on for super users in production but not the rest of the user base.

name: Adyen
description: Adyen offers merchants online services for accepting electronic payments by payment methods including credit cards, bank based payments such as debit cards, bank transfer, and real-time bank transfers based on online banking. Adyen's online payment platform connects to payment methods across the world. Payment methods include international credit cards, local cash-based methods, such as Boleto in Brazil, Internet banking methods, such as iDEAL in the Netherlands and Mobile payment methods, such as Blik in Poland. The technology platform acts as a payment gateway, payment service provider and offers risk management and local acquiring.

name: Gatling
description: Gatling is an open-source load testing tool based on Scala, Akka, and Netty. It allows us to create and conduct high-performance, low-maintenance load tests on local and cloud computers.

name: Templated Runbooks
description: Templated Runbooks is the process of documenting scripts for testing components. It ensures a consistent approach to test and also a framework that enables a greater standard of test and reduced errors to production.

name: contract testing
description: Contract testing is a methodology for ensuring that two separate systems (such as two microservices) are compatible and are able to communicate with one other. It captures the interactions that are exchanged between each service, storing them in a contract, which can then be used to verify that both parties adhere to it.

name: Power BI Visualisation
description: Power BI is a collection of software services, apps, and connectors that work together to turn your unrelated sources of data into coherent, visually immersive, and interactive insights. Your data may be an Excel spreadsheet, or a collection of cloud-based and on-premises hybrid data warehouses. Power BI lets you easily connect to your data sources, visualize and discover what's important, and share that with anyone or everyone you want.

name: Pact
description: Pact is a code-first tool for testing HTTP and message integrations using contract tests. Contract tests assert that inter-application messages conform to a shared understanding that is documented in a contract. Without contract testing, the only way to ensure that applications will work correctly together is by using expensive and brittle integration tests.

name: Adyen Shopper DNA
description: ShopperDNA links clustered transactions to identify a profile of a shopper even as they change devices, networks, and identities. This profile is dynamic and changes based on real-time data.

name: Sentry
description: Sentry is an application monitoring platform, it a lightweight and can sits in both the client of applications and within the mobile browser for uses access via their browser. Through initial testing it is believed this tool will allow us to track local crashes across our digital product portfolio and reported that data to single output. Allowing us to perform accurate monitoring and diagnose of issues and access Realtime insight into errors in the production.

name: Google Cloud Functions
description:
Google Cloud Functions is a serverless execution environment for building and connecting cloud services. With Cloud Functions you write simple, single-purpose functions that are attached to events emitted from your cloud infrastructure and services. Your function is triggered when an event being watched is fired. Your code executes in a fully managed environment. There is no need to provision any infrastructure or worry about managing any servers.

Cloud Functions can be written using JavaScript, Python 3, Go, or Java runtimes on Google Cloud Platform. You can take your function and run it in any standard Node.js (Node.js 10 or 12), Python 3 (Python 3.7 or 3.8), Go (Go 1.11 or 1.13) or Java (Java 11) environment, which makes both portability and local testing a breeze.

name: Traffic Shaping
description: Traffic shaping (also known as packet shaping) is bandwidth management technique that delays the flow of certain types of network packets in order to ensure network performance for higher priority applications. Traffic shaping essentially limits the amount of bandwidth that can be consumed by certain types of applications. It is primarily used to ensure a high quality of service for business-related network traffic.

name: 5G WAN
description: An approach to internet connectivity the usings 5th Generation Mobile internet, where a physical internet connection is not available.

name: Azure DevOps
description: Azure DevOps is a Software as a service (SaaS) platform from Microsoft that provides an end-to-end DevOps toolchain for developing and deploying software. It also integrates with most leading tools on the market and is a great option for orchestrating a DevOps toolchain.

name: Macro Frontends
description: Traditionally monolithic applications tend to have a single front end. Generally, this increases development time. We should strive to build with Marco Frontends, a technique that dictates that you build multiple frontends seamlessly embedded within a single application. This allows more developers to work concurrently, as well as reduces the risk of complete failure, if one of the front ends fail part in the application may not be available but other elements will continue to work.

name: azure pim
description: Privileged Identity Management (PIM) is a service in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) that enables you to manage, control, and monitor access to important resources in your organization. These resources include resources in Azure AD, Azure, and other Microsoft Online Services such as Microsoft 365 or Microsoft Intune.

name: Data Loss Prevention
description:
Data loss prevention (DLP), per Gartner, may be defined as technologies which perform both content inspection and contextual analysis of data sent via messaging applications such as email and instant messaging, in motion over the network, in use on a managed endpoint device, and at rest in on-premises file servers or in cloud applications and cloud storage. These solutions execute responses based on policy and rules defined to address the risk of inadvertent or accidental leaks or exposure of sensitive data outside authorized channels.

DLP technologies are broadly divided into two categories – Enterprise DLP and Integrated DLP. While Enterprise DLP solutions are comprehensive and packaged in agent software for desktops and servers, physical and virtual appliances for monitoring networks and email traffic, or soft appliances for data discovery, Integrated DLP is limited to secure web gateways (SWGs), secure email gateways (SEGs), email encryption products, enterprise content management (ECM) platforms, data classification tools, data discovery tools, and cloud access security brokers (CASBs).

name: Android - Operations
description: Currently the stores use a mix of end user compute hardware, this includes thin terminal, PCR Tablets, Training Tablets, and Windows based tills. In an ideal world we would converge into a single Ecosystem where possible, although this is unlikely to be completely possible we should asses that Android Devices can do for Pret.

name: IOS - Operations
description: Currently the stores use a mix of end user compute hardware, this includes thin terminal, PCR Tablets, Training Tablets, and Windows based tills. In an ideal world we would converge into a single Ecosystem where possible, although this is unlikely to be completely possible we should asses that IOS devices can do for Pret.

name: AliPay
description: Alipay is an eWallet app that lets users store debit or credit card details to make online and in-store purchases using their phones. It works as a mobile wallet-based payment method, similar to the likes of Apple Pay.

name: Wee chat
description: WeeChat (Wee Enhanced Environment for Chat) is a free and open-source Internet Relay Chat client that is designed to be light and fast. It is released under the terms of the GNU GPL-3.0-or-later and has been developed since 2003.

name: NoSQL
description: NoSQL databases (aka "not only SQL") are non-tabular databases and store data differently than relational tables. NoSQL databases come in a variety of types based on their data model. The main types are document, key-value, wide-column, and graph. They provide flexible schemas and scale easily with large amounts of data and high user loads.

name: Cisco DNA
description: Cisco DNA Center is a powerful network controller and management dashboard that lets you take charge of your network, optimize your Cisco investment, and lower your IT spending.

name: Azure AD
description: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) is Microsoft’s cloud-based identity and access management service.

name: R&A 20.1 BI API
description: Historically Pret have need to pull data out of the Simphony EPoS system through Oracle Extensibility platform which require both constant maintenance and Simphony versions change as well as the current mechanism required the shop to be on the Pret network. Oracle have no vastly important both their Reporting and Analytics and more important that BI API. This allows us to pull data directly from the Oracle Cloud. While not yet tested if these enhancements can remove the need for agent software from the till it would more us one step closer to removing the shops dependence on the network.

name: Dynamic Build
Deliverect Tunnel
description: Pret currently use Deliverect to provide incoming order aggregation from the like to Ubereats and Deliveroo. Incoming orders are pushed through MuleSoft to the till too generate the order. The issue with this is it requires the shop to be connected to the network to route the order. Deliverect have developed a new agent that runs on the till then connects outwards across the internet to the Deliverect platform. We should asses this product and replace if feasible as this is another step toward shops no longer needing connection to the wider Pret network.

name: Starkis
description: StarKis is Prets in house-built production platform. Built on PowerBuilder, and backed by a SQL database. Its build using a monolithic client-server architecture which heavily constrains the platform, both in terms of scalability and reliability. The client nature also requires the used of Virtual Desktop technology to access it rather then more modern technologies. We should hold this platform as we slowly build out a replacement web based platform, designed with modularity in mind.

name: Monorepo Tooling
description: In version control systems, a monorepo ("mono" meaning 'single' and "repo" being short for 'repository') is a software development strategy where code for many projects is stored in the same repository. As of 2017, various forms of this software engineering practice were over two decades old, but the general concept had only recently been named. Many attempts have been made to differentiate between monolithic applications and other, newer forms of monorepos.

name: Apple VAS
Standard Libraries
description: Pret currently use a plethora of development technologies, while this does offer some benefits it can also create skill gaps where we have too few people that understand a specific component. We should move to a place where we agree specific libraries and they are reused where possible. If a library is no longer viable it becomes deprecated then replaced with another that all products should adopt.

name: DLQ Management and Replay Tooling
description: A type of test execution tool where inputs are recorded during manual testing in order to generate automated test scripts that can be executed later (i.e. replayed). These tools are often used to support automated regression testing.

name: Hotjar
description: Hotjar is a product experience insights tool that gives you behavior analytics and feedback data to help you empathize with and understand your customers through tools like Heatmaps, Session Recordings, Surveys, and an Incoming Feedback widget.

name: Spring Boot
description: Spring Boot is an open-source micro framework maintained by a company called Pivotal. It provides Java developers with a platform to get started with an auto configurable production-grade Spring application. With it, developers can get started quickly without losing time on preparing and configuring their Spring application.

name: Data quality monitoring tools (e.g. Talend)
description: Data quality is the measure of how well suited a data set is to serve its specific purpose. Measures of data quality are based on data quality characteristics such as accuracy, completeness, consistency, validity, uniqueness, and timeliness.

name: Native Passbook
description: Passbooks are applications that act as wallets, they store information like credentials, balances, Subscription ID’s etc. Currently we don’t store these details but we should assess the value of using the device native passbooks to enhance our digital offering.

name: Eagle Eye Stored credit
description: Pret already use Eagle Eye to provide validation of our coffee subscriptions. Beyond this Eagle Eye also has the ability to maintain user account balances for gift cards, something we currently use Givex for, this gives us a great chance to consolidate a supplier.

name: Store Everything
description: As default as new data is generated in our application landscape we should seek to capture that data in our data platform. The only modifications that should be made are to comply with legislation (for example we may choose to scrub GDPR related data).

name: Saucelabs
description: Sauce Labs allows users to run tests in the cloud on more than 700 different browser platform, operating system and device combinations, providing a comprehensive test infrastructure for automated and manual testing of desktop and mobile applications using Selenium, Appium and JavaScript unit testing frameworks.

name: Content filtering
description: Content filtering is the use of a program to screen and/or exclude access to web pages or email deemed objectionable.

name: Cisco Umbrella
description: Cisco Umbrella is a Cloud driven Secure Internet Gateway that provides protection from Internet based threats, for users wherever they go. Umbrella’s global network processes billions of requests per day, analysing and learning internet activity to determine where attacks are being staged, so it can block requests to unwanted and malicious destinations before a connection is even established.

name: Notification Webhooks (Network Monitoring)
description: A webhook (also called a web callback or HTTP push API) is a way for an app to provide other applications with real-time information. A webhook delivers data to other applications as it happens, meaning you get data immediately. Unlike typical APIs where you would need to poll for data very frequently in order to get it real-time. This makes webhooks much more efficient for both provider and consumer. The only drawback to webhooks is the difficulty of initially setting them up.

name: Flow Preference
description: Flow Preference is a feature of the Meraki Auto-On VPN that allow the granular configuration of the flow of traffic over the VPN based on its attributes. The plan is to added this feature and identify if there are any benefits that could be gained from it.

name: VPN redundancy
description: VPN Redundancy, simply put is having multiple VPN tunnels running across different routes concurrently this builds resilience because if one tunnel collapses the other still persists due to the divergent routing, meaning there is no interruption to service.

name: Azure Bastion
description: Azure Bastion is a fully managed service that provides more secure and seamless Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) and Secure Shell Protocol (SSH) access to virtual machines (VMs) without any exposure through public IP addresses.

name: Veeam
description: Veeam Backup & Replication is a software product developed by Veeam Software to backup, restore and replicate data on virtual machines (VMs).

name: GCP APIgee API Management
description: Apigee is a platform for developing and managing APIs. By fronting services with a proxy layer, Apigee provides an abstraction or facade for your backend service APIs and provides security, rate limiting, quotas, analytics, and more.

name: Azure Application Gateways
description: Azure Application Gateway is a web traffic load balancer that enables you to manage traffic to your web applications. Traditional load balancers operate at the transport layer (OSI layer 4 - TCP and UDP) and route traffic based on source IP address and port, to a destination IP address and port.

name: BitBucket
description: BitBucket is the legacy tool used for the storage and version control of our source code, primarily in the Mulesoft space. Efforts should be made to consolidate code management into Github.

name: Okta
description: Okta is a secure identity cloud that links all your apps, logins and devices into a unified digital fabric. Okta has been Pret's corporate SSO solution for 3 years. While a capable platform it duplicates much of the capability provided by other tools in the emerging estate. As identity services migrate to Azure AD for all Pret employees, we should consider whether Okta is really required.

name: Ngrok
description: ngrok is a cross-platform application that enables developers to expose a local development server to the Internet with minimal effort. The software makes your locally-hosted web server appear to be hosted on a subdomain of ngrok.com, meaning that no public IP or domain name on the local machine is needed. Similar functionality can be achieved with Reverse SSH Tunneling, but this requires more setup as well as hosting of your own remote server. Ngrok is a very interesting tool, however we struggled to get their attention commercially, so production use cases should be avoided.

name: Givex
description: Givex is a stored Credit provider that is currently used by Pret to manage the value assigned to a validation of loyalty card. While Givex has served its purpose we would like to move over to Eagle Eye who we currently use for Coffee subscriptions.

name: Mulesoft
description: MuleSoft provides the most widely used integration platform for connecting SaaS & enterprise applications in the cloud and on-premise. Mulesoft has proven to be an expensive choice for Pret, both in terms of its licencing model, and our ability to source skilled engineers. Mule continues to overcome connectivity challenges in the integration space and has encapsulated platforms like Netsuite well, but further use of its toolset should be approached with caution.

name: Kotlin
description: Kotlin is an open-source, statically-typed programming language that supports both object-oriented and functional programming. Kotlin provides similar syntax and concepts from other languages, including C#, Java, and Scala, among many others. Kotlin does not aim to be unique—instead, it draws inspiration from decades of language development. It exists in variants that target the JVM (Kotlin/JVM), JavaScript (Kotlin/JS), and native code (Kotlin/Native).

name: ChargeBee
description: Chargebee is the subscription billing and revenue management platform that underpins our subscription offering. The tool was invaluable in bringing the offer to market and supported our first year well, but has started to creak under the strain as we scale. Chargebee's team have struggled to keep pace with our feature appetite and a few production incidents have left us feeling that it's probably time to consider the future of the platform. Given capacity, and the importance of subscription to Pret, this will be a protracted retirement but in the meantime we should consider use of native features carefully.

name: Braze CRM
description: Braze CRM is an email marketing and customer data platform currently in use by Pret but due to be replaced by Atreemo provided by The Access Group.

name: http4k
description: http4k is a lightweight but fully-featured HTTP toolkit written in pure Kotlin that enables the serving and consuming of HTTP services in a functional and consistent way.

name: Junit
description: Unit is a Regression Testing Framework used by developers to implement unit testing in Java, and accelerate programming speed and increase the quality of code.

name: change control
description: Most people may see change control as an unusual concept to be but on hold. To be more specific we are putting on hold the historic change control process. In an ecosystem when CI/CD is becoming the go to approach the concept of micro-upgrades, with automated test and simple rollbacks replaces the old style of Change Requests and CAB meetings.

name: Azure docker
description: Docker is a platform the allows of conterend application virtualistion. Pret has previously considered that as a technology for future use. However, tools like Google Cloud Run that do no require the same configuration overhead and have better and more cost effective scaling options. This leaves docker redundant on our radar.

name: MailJet
description: Mailjet is an all-in-one solution to send, track and deliver transactional, notification and marketing emails. Use it to engage and interact with your client base via email and analyze the communication. Pret's mailjet instance has struggled with deliverability issues and support has been lacking from the mailjet team.

name: DDOS Protection
description: DDOS Protection is hardware and software components designed to protect against Distributed Denial of Service attacks. We have put this on hold, not because DDOS attacks are not a threat but more because we should design our systems in handle DDOS attacks through the process of scaling and internal logic rather then external devices.

name: insightOps Logging
description: InsightOps allows you to centralize your logs from on-premises systems, the computing cloud, and in-house applications. You can organize your logs using Tags, and use InsightOps' robust Search capabilities to discover precise, contextual information about your infrastructure. InsightOps is primarily used with Mulesoft. Cloud native logging is preferred over InsighOps.

name: Secret Server
description: Secret service is a legacy tool that we use to store usernames and passwords of service accounts used by our applications. Both GCP and Azure have their own native equivalents. As part of our move to a cloud native architecture we would migrate over to these tools when we have the chance and remove Secret Server once complete.

name: Crush SFTP Server
description: Crush is a file transfer product that we currently have installed in our on premise data centre. We are putting this to hold as moving to cloud components in Azure and GCP which provide the same functionality is more in keeping with our strategic direction.

name: Managed SQL Server
description: Managed SQL service is provided on the Azure Platform. Managed SQL is not the way forward. It does however provide a mechanism to migrate existing SQL databases into the azure Platform. Nothing new should be developed on SQL Server.

name: PRTG
description: PRTG is a network and server monitoring tool. This tool is very good for monitoring on premise servers and networks. As we move into move could based solutions/platforms we should more to logging & monitoring native to those environments.

name: SCV
description: The SCV data environment was the forerunner to Pret's customer data platform. With the migration to the azure data platform and Atreemo, it is all but defunct, but remains the source for a few reporting use cases. Every effort should be made to decommission it.

name: Salesforce Demandware
description: Demandware is told name for what is now known as Salesforce Commerce Cloud. The current journey however is 18 clicks and should be reviewed alongside side our new digital capabilities.
